educational.hook: Your car's paint has 4 layers. Most people only know about 1. Here's what protects your $30K+ investment: 🧵
educational.body:
Your car's paint has 4 layers. Most people only know about 1. Here's what protects your $30K+ investment: 🧵

1/ E-coat (electrocoat)
Applied at factory. Prevents rust from the inside out. You never see it, but without it, your car would rust through in 2-3 years.

2/ Primer
Bonds paint to metal. Also fills minor imperfections. Factory primer ≠ body shop primer. Quality here determines if your repair lasts 2 years or 20.

3/ Base coat
This is your actual color. Modern metallics have aluminum flakes at specific angles. Why color-matching is harder than it looks.

7. Most shops subcontract bodywork. You're paying a middleman. Ask who's actually doing the work.
8. "Factory finish" is marketing BS. Factory paint is baked at 350°F for hours. We can't replicate that.
9. Metallic and pearl colors cost 2x base colors in material AND labor. Budget accordingly.
10. The best shops are booked 3-4 weeks out. If they can start tomorrow, that's a red flag.
Bonus: Always get 3 quotes. Lowest isn't best, highest isn't either. Middle quote with best portfolio wins.

Hour 11-12: Clear coat. 2-3 coats. This is what gives you that glass finish.
Hour 13: Wet sand and buff. Removing orange peel, getting mirror finish.
Hour 14: Reassemble, align, test all sensors. One misaligned sensor = comeback.
Materials cost: $180. Labor at $75/hr: $1,050. We charge $800 because volume. Cheap shops skip hours 3-4 and 13. You'll see why in 6 months.
Your paint job is only as good as the prep work you can't see. Pay for the process, not just the paint.
